summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons Office of Internal Affairs referral to the DOJ OIG concerning the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York on August 10, 2019. It details allegations that two correctional staff members failed to conduct required inmate counts/rounds prior to Epstein being found unresponsive, and includes initial statements from the involved officers.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York on August 10, 2019, and was later pronounced dead. He is the central figure of the incident report.

persons.name: Officer
persons.context: A correctional officer (GL-05) who, along with a Materials Handler Supervisor, allegedly failed to conduct the 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts/rounds. Stated 'we messed up' and appeared distraught.

persons.name: Materials Handler Supervisor
persons.context: A staff member (WS-04) who, along with a Correctional Officer, allegedly failed to conduct required inmate counts/rounds. Admitted to not completing rounds.

persons.name: Operations Lieutenant
persons.context: The lieutenant who responded to the medical emergency, administered CPR, and took initial statements from the involved officers regarding their failure to conduct rounds.

persons.name: Union President
persons.context: Local union official whom the involved staff members wanted to contact to review any memorandums they would have to write about the incident.

connections.description: Worked together on the same shift in the Special Housing Unit and both allegedly failed to conduct required inmate counts/rounds.
Officer was responsible for the supervision and count of inmates, including Epstein, in the Special Housing Unit.
Supervisor was responsible for duties related to inmate supervision in the housing unit where Epstein was held.
The lieutenant took statements from the officer regarding the failure to conduct rounds during the incident investigation.
The officer sought to have the Union President review any memorandums written about the incident.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his assigned cell (Z06-220) in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York. CPR was administered, and he was transported to a hospital.

events.title: Epstein Pronounced Dead
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was pronounced dead at 7:36 a.m. by an emergency room physician at a local hospital (identified elsewhere as Beekman Hospital).

events.title: Failure to Conduct Inmate Counts
events.description: The involved Correctional Officer and Materials Handler Supervisor admitted to not conducting the required 3:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m. inmate counts/rounds in the Special Housing Unit.

events.title: Internal Affairs Referral to OIG
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons Office of Internal Affairs formally referred the incident to the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) for investigation, citing allegations of endangering an inmate, inattention to duty, and failure to follow policy.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York at approximately 6:33 a.m. on August 10, 2019, and was pronounced dead at a hospital at 7:36 a.m.
Two BOP staff members—a Correctional Officer and a Materials Handler Supervisor—admitted to failing to conduct the mandatory 3 a.m. and 5 a.m. inmate counts/rounds prior to Epstein being found.
One of the officers stated 'we messed up' and 'I messed up, she's not to blame we didn't do any rounds' to the Operations Lieutenant.
The involved staff claimed they were traumatized by the event, requested to go home, and wanted their union president to review any statements they wrote.

The BOP Office of Internal Affairs referred the case to the DOJ Office of the Inspector General on August 12, 2019, citing allegations of endangering inmate safety, inattention to duty, and failure to follow policy.
